intro: Asclepias nyikana, commonly known as the Nyikana milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is typical of the genus Asclepias. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers arranged in umbels, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, while the stem is erect and woody. Asclepias nyikana plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
